repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/37936

Solution: see PR title

Closes https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/37936.

<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->

comment_data.body: We shouldn't do this because of dynamic registrations
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -193,8 +193,14 @@ function M.get_namespace(client_id, is_pull)
 
   local client = lsp.get_client_by_id(client_id)
   if is_pull then
-    local key = ('%d'):format(client_id)
-    local name = ('nvim.lsp.%s.%d'):format(client and client.name or 'unknown', client_id)
+    local server_id =
+      vim.tbl_get((client or {}).server_capabilities or {}, 'diagnosticProvider', 'identifier')

comment_data.body: Right. Should be fixed by 9b7ea85fc1f3 where I'm using a caller-provided pull request ID.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -193,8 +193,14 @@ function M.get_namespace(client_id, is_pull)
 
   local client = lsp.get_client_by_id(client_id)
   if is_pull then
-    local key = ('%d'):format(client_id)
-    local name = ('nvim.lsp.%s.%d'):format(client and client.name or 'unknown', client_id)
+    local server_id =
+      vim.tbl_get((client or {}).server_capabilities or {}, 'diagnosticProvider', 'identifier')

comment_data.body:
I think this would be clearer with a vim.validate call and then can just be
local provider_id = pull_id or 'nil'
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -188,13 +188,19 @@ local client_pull_namespaces = {}
 ---
 ---@param client_id integer The id of the LSP client
 ---@param is_pull boolean? Whether the namespace is for a pull or push client. Defaults to push
-function M.get_namespace(client_id, is_pull)
+---@param pull_id string? Pull diagnostics provider identifier
+function M.get_namespace(client_id, is_pull, pull_id)
   vim.validate('client_id', client_id, 'number')
 
   local client = lsp.get_client_by_id(client_id)
   if is_pull then
-    local key = ('%d'):format(client_id)
-    local name = ('nvim.lsp.%s.%d'):format(client and client.name or 'unknown', client_id)
+    local provider_id = type(pull_id) == 'string' and pull_id or 'nil'

@@ -188,13 +188,19 @@ local client_pull_namespaces = {}
 ---
 ---@param client_id integer The id of the LSP client
 ---@param is_pull boolean? Whether the namespace is for a pull or push client. Defaults to push
-function M.get_namespace(client_id, is_pull)
+---@param pull_id string? Pull diagnostics provider identifier
+function M.get_namespace(client_id, is_pull, pull_id)
   vim.validate('client_id', client_id, 'number')
 
   local client = lsp.get_client_by_id(client_id)
   if is_pull then
-    local key = ('%d'):format(client_id)
-    local name = ('nvim.lsp.%s.%d'):format(client and client.name or 'unknown', client_id)
+    local provider_id = type(pull_id) == 'string' and pull_id or 'nil'

comment_data.body:
if we add this field can we drop `is_pull`? and for back-compat, declare `is_pull` like this (it's safe to rename it):

    pull_id: boolean?|string?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2074,14 +2074,15 @@ from({diagnostics})                                *vim.lsp.diagnostic.from()*
         (`lsp.Diagnostic[]`)
 
                                           *vim.lsp.diagnostic.get_namespace()*
-get_namespace({client_id}, {is_pull})
+get_namespace({client_id}, {is_pull}, {pull_id})
     Get the diagnostic namespace associated with an LSP client
     |vim.diagnostic| for diagnostics
 
     Parameters: ~
       • {client_id}  (`integer`) The id of the LSP client
       • {is_pull}    (`boolean?`) Whether the namespace is for a pull or push
                      client. Defaults to push
+      • {pull_id}    (`string?`) Pull diagnostics provider identifier

comment_data.body:
using the same "nonce" helps discovery

```suggestion
    it('uses pull_id to isolate pull diagnostic namespaces', function()
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -351,6 +351,89 @@ describe('vim.lsp.diagnostic', function()
       eq('Pull Diagnostic', diags[1].message)
     end)
 
+    it('does not clear push diagnostics when pull diagnostics are empty', function()
+      local push_ns_count, pull_ns_count, all_diags_count, push_ns, pull_ns = exec_lua(function()
+        vim.lsp.diagnostic.on_publish_diagnostics(nil, {
+          uri = fake_uri,
+          diagnostics = {
+            _G.make_error('Push Diagnostic', 0, 0, 0, 0),
+          },
+        }, { client_id = client_id })
+
+        vim.lsp.diagnostic.on_diagnostic(nil, {
+          kind = 'full',
+          items = {},
+        }, {
+          params = {
+            textDocument = { uri = fake_uri },
+          },
+          uri = fake_uri,
+          client_id = client_id,
+          bufnr = diagnostic_bufnr,
+        }, {})
+
+        local push_ns = vim.lsp.diagnostic.get_namespace(client_id, false)
+        local pull_ns = vim.lsp.diagnostic.get_namespace(client_id, true)
+
+        return #vim.diagnostic.get(diagnostic_bufnr, { namespace = push_ns }),
+          #vim.diagnostic.get(diagnostic_bufnr, { namespace = pull_ns }),
+          #vim.diagnostic.get(diagnostic_bufnr),
+          push_ns,
+          pull_ns
+      end)
+
+      eq(1, push_ns_count)
+      eq(0, pull_ns_count)
+      eq(1, all_diags_count)
+      neq(push_ns, pull_ns)
+    end)
+
+    it('uses pull request identifier to isolate pull diagnostic namespaces', function()

comment_data.body: We can currently end up with `is_pull=true` and `pull_id=nil`. How would that work if we collapsed them into a single field? Would the caller be expected to pass `'nil'` in that case?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2074,14 +2074,15 @@ from({diagnostics})                                *vim.lsp.diagnostic.from()*
         (`lsp.Diagnostic[]`)
 
                                           *vim.lsp.diagnostic.get_namespace()*
-get_namespace({client_id}, {is_pull})
+get_namespace({client_id}, {is_pull}, {pull_id})
     Get the diagnostic namespace associated with an LSP client
     |vim.diagnostic| for diagnostics
 
     Parameters: ~
       • {client_id}  (`integer`) The id of the LSP client
       • {is_pull}    (`boolean?`) Whether the namespace is for a pull or push
                      client. Defaults to push
+      • {pull_id}    (`string?`) Pull diagnostics provider identifier

comment_data.body: Is `is_pull=true + pull_id=nil` actually useful or just legacy? Legacy callers will pass `pull_id=true` and we can simply handle that for back-compat.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2074,14 +2074,15 @@ from({diagnostics})                                *vim.lsp.diagnostic.from()*
         (`lsp.Diagnostic[]`)
 
                                           *vim.lsp.diagnostic.get_namespace()*
-get_namespace({client_id}, {is_pull})
+get_namespace({client_id}, {is_pull}, {pull_id})
     Get the diagnostic namespace associated with an LSP client
     |vim.diagnostic| for diagnostics
 
     Parameters: ~
       • {client_id}  (`integer`) The id of the LSP client
       • {is_pull}    (`boolean?`) Whether the namespace is for a pull or push
                      client. Defaults to push
+      • {pull_id}    (`string?`) Pull diagnostics provider identifier

comment_regular_data.body: @noib3 you need to run `make doc` to update documentation.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(lsp): keep pull and push diagnostics in separate namespaces
